result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor Michael Tallman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for CIP and SAP after 2 years of initial confinement.
Consecutive to: 21CF307

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored. No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substances without a valid Rx. No contact with the victim or her residence. No contact with known drug users or dealers, unless in a treatment setting, and only with prior agent approval.
Maintain/obtain full time employment. Any other assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Payment of restitution if claim is made. DNA Sample Due: 5-24-2022.

Payment of restitution if claim is made.
